text: Daleho Irandust (, ; born 4 June 1998) is a Swedish footballer who plays as an attacking midfielder for BK Häcken in the Swedish Allsvenskan. He also represents the Swedish under-21 team and the Swedish national team. ==Club career== ===BK Häcken=== Born and raised in Gothenburg, Daleho Irandust won the Gothia Cup in 2016 with the under-19 side of BK Häcken.https://bkhacken.se/player/daleho-irandust-2/ Irandust made his debut for the senior side of Häcken with a goal and two assists on 24 August 2016 against Växjö in the 2016–17 Svenska Cupen. He made his Allsvenskan debut for Häcken on 9 April 2017 against Djurgården. He scored his first Allsvenskan goal for the club on 5 May 2017 against Sirius, before scoring his second a week later in a 1–0 win at Kalmar. He was nominated for the newcomer of the year award at the end of the 2017 Allsvenskan season with 2 goals and 5 assists.https://www.expressen.se/gt/sport/talangen-tror-pa-seger-mot-malmo-/ Irandust scored a free kick against Norrby after opening the scoring against Värnamo in the 2017–18 Svenska Cupen.https://www.fotbollskanalen.se/video/3958852/irandust-ger-hacken- ledningen-efter-fantastisk-frispark/ He scored his first goal of the 2018 Allsvenskan season on 7 July 2018 against GIF Sundsvall. He made his UEFA debut in the following match with a goal and an assist on 12 July in the 2018–19 UEFA Europa League.https://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=104&artikel;=6998071 He scored another goal in the next round of the Europa League for a 1–1 draw against German Bundesliga side RB Leipzig.https://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2019/matches/round=2000987/match=2024858/index.html Irandust scored his first goal of the 2019 Allsvenskan season in their opening match against Malmö FF and provided an assist to Alexander Faltsetas in the Swedish Cup final to qualify Häcken for the 2019–20 UEFA Europa League.https://www.fotbollskanalen.se/svenska-cupen-1/tv-hacken-cupmaststare ----tog-saker-seger-mot-afc-i-finalen/ He scored his first goal of the 2020 Allsvenskan season in their opening match against Falkenberg before scoring from his own half a week later against IK Sirius.https://streamable.com/cj9s2qhttps://www.fotbollskanalen.se/allsvenskan/irandusts- galna-fulltraff---drommal-fran-egen-planhalva-okej-mal/ ==International career== ===Youth=== Irandust has played for the Sweden national under-19 football team. Due to his Kurdish-Iranian heritage, Irandust is eligible to play for either Sweden or Iran. In June 2017, Irandust reaffirmed his decision to represent Sweden over Iran.http://www.aftonbladet.se/sportbladet/fotboll/a/JanLR/de-horde-av-sig- fran-iran-jag-sa-bara-nej--jag-vill-inte/ He was called into the Sweden national under-21 football team on 27 August 2017 for the 2019 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification. Irandust made his debut for the under-21s on 7 June 2018 with an assist to Carlos Strandberg in a 4–0 win over Malta.http://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2018-06-07/football/Under-21-UEFA- European-Championship-qualifier-Malta-no-match-for-strong-Sweden-6736191284 He was called into the under-21 squad in August 2019 for the start of their 2021 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification campaign.https://www.svenskfotboll.se/nyheter/landslag/2019/8/nilssons-trupp- till-em-kvalstarten/ He provided assists to Pontus Almqvist and Gustav Henriksson in September 2020 during a 3–0 win over Italy. https://www.fotbollskanalen.se/landslag/tv-svensk-kross---u21-landslaget- korde-over-italien/ ===Senior=== Irandust was called into the Sweden national football team by manager Janne Andersson on 3 December 2018 for their January 2019 friendly matches against Finland and Iceland.https://www.fotbollskanalen.se/sverige/irandust-en-av-tre-uttagna- hacken-spelare-finns-ytterligare-ett-steg/ He made his international debut for Sweden on 8 January 2019 against Finland.https://www.svenskfotboll.se/matchfakta/sverige-finland-landskamper- herr-senior/4105980/ ==Style of play== Irandust has been praised for his creativity and sharp left foot. ==Outside football== ===Personal life=== Daleho Irandust was born and raised in Gothenburg to Kurdish-Iranian parents. ===Sponsorship=== Irandust is outfitted by American sportswear manufacturer Nike.http://www.gp.se/sport/fotboll/han-ligger-bakom-h%C3%A4ckens- specialtr%C3%B6ja-1.3481101
